CatDescriptText: Mr. Stanley Gray, recently discharged serviceman, of 1316 Collier Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that American citizens should receive Russia's first deputy premier, Anastas I. Mikoyan hospitably, or deport themselves in unhospitable fashion like some have done in several cities where Mikoyan has visited?" answer reads: �Actually, like the President says, Mr. Mikoyan should be treated hospitably. Our country is not noted for unhospitable treatment to its guests.  Most of the trouble, which Mr. Mikoyan has received, has been from Hungarian refugees who have a good right to be angry.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Stanley Gray, wearing hat with dark band, goatee, plaid shirt, dark sweater with light colored V shape, and light colored zippered jacket, holding newspaper under left arm, standing with hands in pockets on sidewalk in front of building with light colored wall and glass block window
